title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 521/86 of 27 February 1986 derogating temporarily from Regulation (EEG) No 685/69 as regards the day on which butter bought in by intervention agencies is taken over
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 521/86
of 27 February 1986
derogating temporarily from Regulation (EEG) No 685/69 as regards the day on which butter bought in by intervention agencies is taken over
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
By way of derogation from Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 685/69, the day of taking-over shall, until the end of the 1985/86 milk year, be the 60th day after the date on which the butter entered the cold storage depot designated by the intervention agency.
Until the end of the 1985/86 milk year, the references to the taking over of the butter, which are found in Articles 4 and 6 of the Regulation referred to above, shall be replaced by references to the butter's 'entry into the cold storage depot designated by the intervention agency'.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 27 February 1986.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
